intro: Sieglingia microdon, commonly known as the dwarf sieve-plant, is a small, herbaceous perennial native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves that give it a delicate appearance. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Sieglingia microdon is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks.
